column4: where to i change the forced fsck every 30 mounts on boot to a higher number?
man tunefs
if i were you i would leave it like that
just don't reboot your system :-)
or switch to XFS (lovely)
there's no tunefs command on man........ ?
tune2fs ?
thanks, that exists
totem-xine i meant
check under Advanced preferences for multimedia sinks
gstreamer lets you choose your output sinks and so on
uh, that's a different beast ... i don't know that
i dont think i have these advanced prefs.... anyone else knows maybe?
that's part of gstreamer-*
Applications->Preferences->Advanced->Multimedia System Selector
definitely not Xine
you might want to see what can you do from a .xinerc or something (all UNIX apps are like that)
which movie formats does gstreamer support ? i think none ?
gstreamer is a framework... as many as you want to install (and have been written) ... it's not as stable as xine, so, don't worry about it for a year or so
install all the gstreamer libs anyway, they are nice to have
any movie codecs have been written for gstreamer yet ?
i'm not sure, but you might want to read gstreamer-devel mailing list (i'm a member and i see all kinds of tricks being done for encoding movies from C/comand line etc...)
